comment: I loved Professor Ghosh and thought that she was really skilled in teaching her class. This class does consist of assignments that take a pretty long time to complete, however. I would recommend taking another course if you are looking for one with less work

Super great professor and would definitely take her again! Extremely work heavy class though and its really easy to get burnt. Although its a lot of work she makes it pretty easy to get an A. As longs you try that is all that matters.

Great professor, didn't like it at first, but she is a great teacher. If you are just looking for an easy class to take because English has nothing to do with your major, don't take this class, its quite a bit of work. But if you want a class that will teach you how to properly write and research for essays, this is it. Also, group work was great.

Extremely heavy workload, this class was as much work as my other 4 classes combined. Also the whole class leads up to one essay so you get burn out about halfway through the semester. Go elsewhere if you can.

Dr. Ghosh is one of the best professors I've had, she really cares about the student and provides excellent feedback to ensure all her students succeed. There are assignments due every Tuesday and Thursdays but overall they are easy but may take a while to do. Her assignment have samples so its really easy to see what she wants.

THE sweetest human being! Really really cares about your success, two submissions a week, lengthy discussions, very detailed requirements and expectations, very approachable, weekly readings, easy grader if you try, and two small presentations. This class was tough and time consuming at times, but genuinely made me a better writer. So rewarding!

Dr. Ghosh is super sweet and responds to emails super quick, the one issue I have with her is the entire semester is built off of one paper and she can be super slow with grading. Her instructions are not the clearest but as long as you try she gives good credit. Solid choice, if you can find someone easier take them
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: This class is not a good one to take. Dr. Ghosh is extremely slow with grading, waiting until the last two weeks to enter grades from the first month of the semester. You are allowed three absences but otherwise attendance is mandatory. Directions for assignments are extremely confusing and there are assignments due very often.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Her assignment descriptions were the most confusing thing and on top of that she was extremely inflexible. I told her that I would be missing ONE class due to a family emergency and instead of making sure I was okay she responded saying that I would be getting a zero and focused on the work that would be missed instead. 100% do not recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Good teacher and helped improve my writing with ideas such as writing as if responding to arguements already written But confusing grading (graded ALL discussion posts at the end and so unkown grade although easy) and had privilege as the topic Gave interesting ideas like privilege of being able to walk but all the hw was on white or male privilege

Professor Ghosh was super nice and the only reason I didn't rate her worse is because you can absolutely tell she has a passion for her job and works with students, as well as gives great feedback for passing her class. However, the entire thing was building up to do a 10-page paper. Like half of the time in this class was dedicated to one paper.

Professor Gosh was by far one of the best professors I have ever had! She genuinely cares so much about what and how you write. She is super fast when it comes to replying to emails and has constant open discussions in class! 100% reccomend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The class has discussion post once a week and many other assignments that are given parts at a time and clearly explained every class. It seems like a lot of work, but shes an easy grader will give all As as long as you give effort. Just do your best and youll pass, extra credit is given at the end!! Shes also really kind and willing to help!

Professor Ghosh was a real gem this past semester. She is very passionate and initially I had mistaken it for harshness. In reality, she is a fair/kind grader as long as you really tried your best and worked to improve yourself... she takes notice. This was the best class I had this semester. Take her if you get to chance, but also be ready to work

She was really nice. You are graded on discussion posts and responses which are pretty easy as long as you do them you get a good grade. You have 3 essays but its over a course of time and she gives you step by step instructions on D2L. She also has extra credit for the end of the semester.

She uses 2 books to teach us and explains the readings in class. Her feedback is helpful in knowing what to fix in our papers. She has us peer review and communicating outside of class. She is an easy grader although the class load is a lot since it is an English class with one discussion each week based off of a reading assigned.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Get ready to read

comment: I definitely recommend taking Dr. Ghosh's class. She's very new to teaching, but clearly shows a passion for her job. Her class does revolve a little around gender/social issues which may be off-putting to some. She grades easily and is open to her students' input. There is a semester-long research paper but other than that it's mostly busy work.
